Viewing Server Configuration Options

The application Server stores server configuration options in the database specified when the server configuration was created. When you start a server configuration for the first time, the Server automatically adds the server configuration options, with default values, to the database. You should review these configuration options to be sure that the settings are satisfactory.

Note: A server configuration must be running before you can review its configuration options. See Modifying a Server Configuration.

Configuration Options

The following list shows all server configuration options. Some are editable; others are included only for informational purposes.

General Tab

Option: Server startup log file
Default: ..repository_path\DefaultHive\server.log
Comments: Read-only; path specified when creating a new server configuration.

Option: Attachments path
Default: ..repository_path\Attachments
Comments: Editable path; folder created by the Server. If you change the attachments location, you must restart the server. While the server is down, you should also move files in the attachments folder to the new location.

Option: Logon sequence timeout
Default: 60 seconds
Comments: Amount of time allowed for the client to make the connection to the Server. Any logon not completed within this amount of time will fail. Maximum logon sequence time is 5 minutes.

Option: Inactivity timeout __ minutes
Default: Off
Comments: If this option is selected and a specific length of time entered by an administrator, users who are inactive for that length of time will automatically be logged off. Their session will be deleted from the server, their license will  released, and they must log in again to use the application. However, users will not be logged off by the Inactivity Timeout if they have set their system tray notification for a shorter period of time, due to automatic communications between the client and the server.

Option: Exclude named users

Default: Disabled
Comments: Allows named users who exceed the specified Inactivity Timeout limit to remain logged on. This feature can be selected only when Inactivity Timeout is enabled and a time limit set.

Option: Reconnect timeout __ minutes
Default: 30 minutes
Comments: Determines the amount of time a client has to reestablish its network connection with the server. The client attempts to reconnect only if the user is trying to send a command to the server. After the reconnect time limit passes, the user's session is deleted from the server. Reconnection cannot be performed if the server has been restarted. Also, if the Reconnect and the Inactivity Timeout are both enabled and the Inactivity Timeout is longer, the user may be logged off before the client can re-establish the connection.

Option: Enable e-mail support
Default: Off
Comments: Allows certain types of items to be e-mailed to other users from within the application, even when the recipients are not running the application. Users also receive automatic e-mails when their exclusive locks on items are broken. This feature must be enabled to select the e-mail notifications option. When e-mail support is enabled, an e-mail address must be entered for each user.

Option: SMTP server
Default: Disabled
Comments: Required if e-mail enabled. Enter the hostname for your SMTP server or an IP address if your site uses only static IP addresses.

Option: Port
Default: Disabled
Comments: Default SMTP port is 25 if e-mail enabled. Change this value if your SMTP server uses another port.

Option: Enable e-mail notification
Default: Off
Comments:  Available when Enable e-mail support is selected, an SMTP server is enabled, and a port is specified for the SMTP server. If enabled, users can be notified automatically via e-mail that they have become responsible (or for a change request, requirement, or task, that they are listed as the recipient of a new topic, that a requirement or task for which they are responsible has changed, or that a topic for which they are listed as a recipient has changed. Users do not have to be running a client to receive notification messages.

Audits Tab

Option: Enable audit generation
Default: On
Comments: Audit log data is stored in the server configuration database; if data requires too much space, option can be disabled.

Option: Purge audit entries older than __ days
Default: Off
Comments: Automatically removes audit entries older than a specified number of days to keep the amount of log space required low. Default is 90 days, if option is enabled, while the range is from 7 to 1000 days. The number of days can be edited.

Database Tab

Option: Database type
Default: Disabled
Comments: Read only; database type can be set only when server configuration is created.

Option: DSN
Default: Disabled
Comments: Read only; item can be set only when server configuration is created.

Option: Pooled connections
Default:10
Comments: Increasing the number of pooled connections can improve database transaction throughput. Borland recommends a setting of 20-25 with Microsoft SQL Server.

Verify Native-I Vault Tab (Does not appear for Native-II Vaults)

Option: Vault path
Default: ..\RepositoryPath\Vault
Comments: Editable path; folder created by the Server. If you change the vault location, you must restart the server. While the server is down, you should also move any files in the vault folder to the new location.

Option: Disk cache path
Default: ..\Repository Path\Vault\Cache
Comments: Editable path; folder created by the Server. If you change the disk cache location, you must restart the server. If you move cached files to the new location, do so while the server is down.

Option: Archive path
Default: ..\Repository Path\Vault\ Archive
Comments: Editable path; folder created by the Server. If you change the Archive location, you must restart the server. While the server is down, you should also move files in the Archive folder to the new location.

Option: Verify database at startup
Default: Off
Comments: Borland recommends verifying the database only after restoring a backup or when experiencing database problems. If your company still uses one or more Native-I Vaults (created before StarTeam 2005 and not yet converted to StarTeam 2005 or a later release), another alternative is to go to the Server Administration dialog and click the Verify Native-I Vault icon or select that option from the Tools menu when the server configuration is not running. See the StarTeam Administrator's Guide.

Option: Attempt automatic recovery
Default: Disabled/Off
Comments: Available when Verify database at startup option is selected; if enabled, the verification utility reconciles differences between the server configurations database and the Archive.

Option: Stop server on errors
Default: Disabled/Off
Comments: Option that causes the server to stop if the verification utility reports errors; available when Verify database at startup option is selected.

Option: Maximum cache size
Default: 100 MB
Comments: This option determines how many files can be stored. The server reduces the cache size limit when there is insufficient disk space available, making the reduced size the effective limit. Borland recommends starting with the default size, then editing as required.

Option: Vault file lock time limit
Default: 60 seconds
Comments: Amount of time before the Server releases an internal vault lock. This time limit should be long enough to ensure that a normal check-in process will not be stopped before completion. Borland recommends starting with the default size, then editing as required.

Option: Cache cleanup interval
Default: 10 seconds
Comments: The cache is checked at this interval and, if it exceeds its effective size limit, the server removes the least recently used files from the cache until it reaches 80% of the limit. Borland recommends starting with default size, then editing as required.

Protocol Tab

Option: TCP/IP endpoint
Default: 49201
Comments: To make a port active, enter its number in the Endpoint text box.

Option: TCP/IP encryption levels
Default: No encryption
Comments: Option used to set a minimum encryption level for data transfer; use Add, Remove, and Modify buttons to add or change encryption levels.

Event Handlers Tab

Option: Event handler
Default: None
Comments: Option allows entry or selection of event handler program.

Option: Event handler description
Default: On
Comments: Option allows description of selected event handler program.

Directory Service Tab

Option: Enable directory service support
Default: Off
Comments: Uses the specified Microsoft Active Directory service to validate user passwords. For a user's password to be validated, the Validate with directory service option must also be selected on the New User Properties or User Properties dialog and the Distinguished Name from Microsoft Active Directory service entered for the individual. Restart the StarTeam server configuration to be sure that the connection to the service can be made before setting up the users. The server log contains the connection information; for example, "Connected to Active Directory Server: ldaps://host:port" where host and port are the values you enter on this tab.

Option: Host (required field)
Default: None
Comments: Host name or IP address of the Microsoft Active Directory service; alphanumeric value of up to 254 characters. Instead of using a host name or IP address in the Host text box, you can use a domain name. When you use a domain name, StarTeam Server can contact any active copy of Active Directory anywhere in the domain so long as that copy uses the specified port. Some companies run more than one copy of Active Directory in case one goes down.

Option: Port
Default: 636 (secure)
Comments: Number of a secure SSL port.

Option: Use a Secure Port
Default: On
Comments: Indicates whether the port used by the directory server is secure or non-secure; default is secure.

Diagnostics Tab

Option: Trace operations that take at least __ milliseconds
Default: 0 milliseconds
Comments: Creates a .trc file that allows commands to be traced. Commands are traced if they have a duration time that equals or exceeds the specified number of milliseconds. If 0 (the default) is used, all commands will be traced.

Option: Unexpected conditions
Default: Off
Comments: Creates a diagnostic (.dmp) file for asserts (server log entries with code #8).

Option: Errors
Default: Off
Comments: Creates a diagnostic (.dmp) file for exceptions (server log entries with code #4).
